elements.title: statue of Alfred the Great
elements.contents: ... that the legs of the statue of Alfred the Great in Southwark (pictured) are at least 1,600 years older than the torso?

elements.title: Francis G. Brink
elements.contents: ... that Brigadier General Francis G. Brink, the first commander of Military Assistance Advisory Group Indochina, was found dead at the Pentagon with three bullet wounds in the chest?

elements.title: fried caterpillars
elements.contents: ... that fried caterpillars are a traditional dish in Angola?

elements.title: Witold Pilecki
elements.contents: ... that Polish Home Army resistance fighter Witold Pilecki volunteered to infiltrate the Auschwitz concentration camp?

elements.title: Castle Ten Berghe
elements.contents: ... that Castle Ten Berghe, a manor house built during the 13th century, is now run as a bed and breakfast with a neo-Gothic architectural style?

elements.title: The Perfect Pear
elements.contents: ... that the main storyline of the My Little Pony: Friendship Is Magic episode "The Perfect Pear" comes from a long-running joke among the show's staff?

elements.title: Children's Fantasy Literature
elements.contents: ... that Children's Fantasy Literature is the first work to address the genre's 500-year history in depth?

elements.title: 1978 New York City newspaper strike
elements.contents: ... that the 1978 New York City newspaper strike has been theorized to have caused great misery in Boston sports fans?
